Key Match Events: Washington Sundar took two wickets in the opening four balls of the Super Over.
India beat Sri Lanka in the third T20 to sweep the three-match series 3-0.
Suryakumar Yadav hit a four off the first ball of the Super Over.
Rinku Singh and Suryakumar Yadav picked up four wickets for eight runs in their two overs of spin.
India defended nine runs needed by Sri Lanka off the last 12 balls of its innings.
India scored 137-9 after losing the toss and batting first.
Washington Sundar was named player of the match.
Suryakumar Yadav was named player of the series.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka made two changes and India four, with the fit-again Shubman Gill returning and both Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant rested.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav expressed pride in the team's character and confidence.
Yadav mentioned that he prefers to be a leader rather than just a captain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain had delayed the start of the game.
India had already taken an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series.
The two teams will also play three one-day internationals, starting Friday in Colombo.
